intro: Willdenowia sulcata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm and thrives in humid, well-drained soil. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are often cultivated as ornamental plants. Willdenowia sulcata is known for its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
